Class NotificationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • BBjWidget
      • NotificationManager

  • public class NotificationManager
extends BBjWidget
    -------------------------- Manual -------------------------- The plugin will use the BBjAPI-IDs as follows for each respective Notification (only mind if youÂ´re working on the NotificationControlls themselves) IDS WILL NOT BE BLOCKED OUTSIDE OF A NOTIFICATIONS CONTEXT!!! 1100+ = IDs for the notificationwindows itself and its respective titles 11100+ = IDs for the notifications respective dismissbutton 51100+ = IDs for the notifications respective textfields 101100+ = IDs for the notifications respective timer (only if a timer was given) 175000+ = IDs for custom Buttons on the Notification 1000000 = ID for the Icon on the Notification ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- simple usage guide: initialize an instance of the NotificationManager i.e. mng! = new NotificationManager(1) create a Notification with the addNotification method i.e. mng!.addNotification(text, timeout, title, eventhandle, color, image, List, link) change the animationmode with setAnimate(true/false) , it is false by default ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- optional values are : text, dismiss, title, handle, color, image, buttons, link these can be passed null() if not required and will be left out if an eventhandle was given to the Notification it will push the event 17 which can be caught by processing event onclick: (A Notification has to be cleared manually if it was clicked, which can be performed using the eventhandle delivered by the event and the deletehandle(String handle) method if a timeout was given the Notification will be dismissed on the timeout count (in seconds) if a color (BBjColor) is given it will change the BackgroundColor of the Notification if an image (only BBj-conform formats can be used) is passed it will appear on the left hand side of the Notification as an Icon if Buttons are passed every Item in the List will be added as a Button in the Notification. to pass buttons simply create a java.util.ArrayList and fill it with NotificationButton Objects, provided in the Plugin to create an object call the constructor with new NotificationButton(String text, String eventhandle, int width) and put it in to the List if a link is passed, the Notification will get a little button which will redirect the user to given links ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
